content.description: The route begins with 40' of splitter hands passing an overlap and some interesting 5.10 moves. After the small roof the crack quickly tightens to ringlocks and fingers. Awesome!
content.location: The route faces south down beef basin road. Start off a somewhat exposed shelf (may want to anchor the belayer due to the crumbly rock at the start of the route).

content.description: Very cool three-dimensional climbing! Thin sporty start with small gear to a steep thin section with great stemming. Fun crack switch and a section of thin hands brings you to the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor + chain.  0.2 - 4, extras in 0.5, 0.75s, and 1s
content.location: This route is part of the right cluster of routes at 3D Wall, and is best approached from the 4x4 trail.

content.description:
East till Sunset....Colorado's that way

Stars are for the 2nd pitch or upper corner.

P1: Fun creative climbing through 2 bolts with a thin tips (blue alien) crux on the blackest varnish leads to a comfy ledge with anchor. 60' 5.11+

P2: Super clean and quality left facing fingers corner to fingers to more fingers, and finishes with fingers at a good ledge. Did I mention fingers? 90' 5.11. Just lower and TR from P1 ledge, no need to belay from top.

Super fun and minimal drag to climb as a single pitch, but puts alot of rope in the system for the 2nd at the low crux.
content.protection:
Single 60m

2x blue alien/.2 (P1 only)

3x .3

4x.4

4x.5

Thats it! Maybe a clippy widget or two

If climbing as a single pitch, add one more of each, .3,.4,.5
content.location:
15' Right of Destination Paris

Look for thin corner with two bolts and then the immaculate corner up high

content.description: Great warmup. Start on Night Nurse and climb into the wedge with a .3 - .4 finger crack. A short loose section brings you to secure thin hands that widens to big hands, and a wide section up top.
content.location: Just right of Night Nurse. Hike past the route and back around to start and belay on top of the ledge.

content.description:
20’ of Gumby filter leads you to the base of the first beautiful splitter. 30’ of ever narrowing crack (Red metolious-.2) brings you  to a crack switch face traverse. A few feet of solid flakes leads to a hand jam rest at a solid chockstone. Then a boulder problem sets you back into the final 50’ of endurance 5.12 crack opening from (.3-.75)

Edit: After conversations with other friends, and being called a sandbagger (true): upgrading I still think it’s 12+
content.location: Listed as Open project in Karl’s book. Same start as 3D right

content.description: Start behind a large block and pull onto a ledge with a bit of loose rock. The route follows the  thin hands crack, using the wide crack on the left to ease the grade. When you top out on the pillar, you've got about 10 m of splitter tight hands on the face ahead of you to gain the anchor.

This climb is located on the far left (east facing) side of the 4 X 4 Wall. Bring plenty of gear for the finger stacks/thin hands start (crux) and end it all with a little bit of desert face climbing.  Personally, I would call it an 11, but I tend to get my ass handed to me in a paper bag on steep, thin-hands cracks.
content.protection: Bring your regular ol' Indian Creek rack along, making sure you have several in the .5 to 1 camalot size.

content.description: AKA:  Jimmy's Three Inch Weenie, This is a slightly loose and bouldery start leads to a splitter four-inch crack in a left-facing dihedral. Worm past a small pod and fist up the steep corner to a good rest, then punch through the overhanging rattly fists to the chains.
content.location: This route is located on the far far left side of the 4x4 Wall. The route ascends the same pillar as 3D but on the right side.
